brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the onset and duration of action of AC-170 0.24%
      compared to vehicle in the prevention of the signs and symptoms of allergic conjunctivitis
      in the conjunctival allergen challenge (CAC) model.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multi-Center, Evaluation of the Onset and Duration of Action of AC-170 0.24% Compared to Vehicle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  positive bilateral conjunctival allergen challenge (CAC) reaction

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  known contraindications or sensitivities to the study medication or its components

          -  any ocular condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, could affect the
             subjects safety trial parameters

          -  use of disallowed medication during the period indicated prior to the enrollment or
             during the study

intervention.description: 1 drop in each eye at 2 separate times during a 14 day period
1 drop in each eye at 2 separate times during a 14 day period

clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Double-Masked, Randomized, Vehicle-Controlled, Evaluation of the Onset and Duration of Action of AC-170 0.24% Ophthalmic Solution (Formula AFH-002) Compared to Vehicle (Formula AFH-001) in the Conjunctival Allergen Challenge (CAC) Model of Acute Allergic Conjunctivitis

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Ocular itching at defined time points up to 2 weeks
Ocular redness at defined time points up to 2 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
